newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Suriname president starts 3-day visit in Venezuela.
newsitem.headline: Suriname president starts 3-day visit in Venezuela.

text.p: Suriname's President Jules Wijdenbosch arrived in Venezuela on Wednesday at the start of a three-day official visit aimed at boosting ties between the two South American countries.
Wijdenbosch, who won a tight presidential run-off in the former Dutch colony last September, was met by Venezuela's President Rafael Caldera at La Carlota military airport in central Caracas.
In a brief welcoming address, Caldera stressed the importance of cooperation over development in the Amazon jungle which covers large areas of both countries.
